intro: Triodanis falcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually greenish-white in color. Triodanis falcata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
